message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a machine learning mechanism for session-based recommendation that utilizes deep learning techniques with recurrently connected units. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational linguistics (cs.CL), or social and information networks (cs.SI). However, given the focus on deep learning and Bayesian statistics, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. The use of recommendation systems also suggests cs.IR as a possible sub-category. The use of recurrent neural networks and the focus on temporal dynamics could also suggest cs.CL as a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of session-based recommendation and the focus on real-world datasets could suggest cs.SI as a possible sub-category.
